data.job_description:
• ASX Listed Energy Company - Adelaide Head Office
• Competitive package + bonus + benefits + flexibility
• Mid-size company: big enough for opportunities, small enough to get things done.

At Beach Energy, we are dedicated to advancing exploration and subsurface technologies and we are committed to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in our field, and we are now seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Exploration and Subsurface (E&S) team.

About the Role

You will play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights through data engineering techniques. Leveraging your expertise in SQL and Python, you will collaborate closely with our multidisciplinary team to engineer, integrate, analyse, and interpret data, contribute to decision-making processes, and drive the success of our exploration and subsurface projects.

Key responsibilities will include:
• Utilising a strong skill set in working with SQL Server, including data manipulation, advanced SQL query-building, spatial geometry management, and CRS (coordinate reference system) management in datasets.
• Developing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to automate data transformation workflows, addressing critical information needs and enhancing efficiency.
• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and develop effective solutions using on-prem and cloud technologies.
• Demonstrating competency in developing data models spanning from conceptual to physical, crucial for implementing business information workflows.
• Managing and overseeing SQL databases, ensuring smooth operation, high availability, and optimal performance.

About You

Success in our multidisciplinary team environment requires effective collaboration. The ideal candidate should be a team player, capable of communicating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and working seamlessly with professionals from diverse backgrounds.

A solid foundation in SQL and Python is essential for this role. The candidate should demonstrate expertise in writing logical SQL queries and effective Python scripting according to the industry standards. Familiarity with data visualisation tools will be advantageous.

You will need:
• Effective communication skills with the ability to understand business information requirements and present complex data insights in a clear and understandable manner.
• Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
• Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Spotfire, Power BI and ArcGIS Portal) is a plus.
• Knowledge of geoscience concepts and terminology is desirable but not mandatory.

About Us

Beach Energy is an ASX listed oil and gas exploration and production company. Founded in 1961, our head office is in Adelaide, and we operate in several locations in Australia and in New Zealand.

Beach’s purpose is to ‘sustainably deliver energy for communities. That means we are committed to a just and sustainable energy transition whilst maintaining high health, safety, and environmental standards. See our actions and plans in our Sustainability Report.

How to Apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.

Please submit your application, cover letter and updated CV by 19 October 2023.

For this opportunity you must be eligible to work in Australia.

The role is responsible to systemically review and interpret material to support policy projects and the design of administrative systems.

What you'll need to succeed Experience using statistical packages and big data manipulation tools in particular Microsoft packages Excel, Visio, and Relational Database Management systems Experience in the development and application of analytical techniques and ability to collect, organise, analyse and interpret and disseminate significant amounts of data with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience in delivering and presenting data analytic reports.
Ability to effectively manage competing priorities and complete complex projects and work programs within prescribed deadlines.

High level problem solving and strategic skills, including an ability to involve oneself and others in a process to achieve a shared goal or resolve differences.

• A position that's professionally rewarding | Commencing January 2024
• Access to Mentoring, Coaching and Industry Expertise
• Full Time, 2-Year Fixed Term Graduate Program Opportunity. Requests for part-time hours may be considered.

About the Opportunity

As part of the Adelaide Economic Development Agency (AEDA), you will learn and develop on the job and through a tailored development program, while making a tangible contribution to our team and the City of Adelaide (CoA) more broadly. You will review macroeconomic conditions as well as activity levels in the city including consumer expenditure behaviour, foot-traffic, public transport usage, e-scooter trips, as well as parking and other indicators.

Some of the things you'll see yourself doing with us are:
• Analysing qualitative and quantitative data using Excel or other programs such as PowerBI, Tableau, R, ai, etc.
• Compiling high quality, robust and professional designed reports and briefing notes.
• Assisting in producing or maintaining statistical models, and assisting in designing data visualisations.
• Participating in and contributing to all graduate program projects, training, and other undertakings.

Why Our Graduate Program?

Our graduate program gives you a great opportunity to start building your career, while having our genuine impact on our City and our communities. As a capital city council, we have wide-ranging responsibilities, so you'll be exposed to many different industries. This includes everything from community wellbeing to urban planning, events to infrastructure, lifestyle experiences to heritage, economic development to climate action, corporate services and many more.

Apart from gaining valuable insight into what makes our community unique, you will also have access to a wide range of benefits such as:
• Flexible work arrangements
• A range of health & wellbeing offerings
• On-site gym and chill-out areas
• Social Club events where you get to connect with other colleagues

For more information about what it's like to work for the City of Adelaide, including the benefits, please visit www.cityofadelaide.com.au/careers

About You

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Graduated within approximately the last 2 years or are expecting to graduate within approximately the next 6 months, with a degree in Economics, Data Science, Commerce, Mathematics or related field.
• An understanding of economic indicators at a council level.
• Ability to analyse data, find insights and present information concisely.
• Well-developed verbal and written skills to be able to construct high quality written work/reports.
• Strong organisational skills, the ability to successfully manage competing priorities, maintain attention to detail and meet deadlines.
• A commitment to ongoing professional development, continuous learning, and to building your career.

About Us

Located in the geographic heart of Kaurna Country, the City of Adelaide celebrates its cultural heritage, unique natural surrounds and structures its footprint in a way that allows it to adapt to the changing needs of the community and a dynamic global landscape. Our focus is on our community's wellbeing and quality of life - investing in city improvements and on future planning, so we continue to design a liveable city where future generations can continue to live authentic and meaningful lives. This is an exciting opportunity to join our team and be a bigger part of our amazing city!

To find out what our people love about what they do please watch this video.

AEDA works closely with businesses, industry groups, the state government and other relevant organisations to deliver a range of programs designed to stimulate the city's economic growth. AEDA's focus is investment attraction, growing our visitor economy, residential growth, marketing the city as a whole and promoting Rundle Mall as Adelaide's premier shopping destination.

At the City of Adelaide, we thrive in an environment that is welcoming, inclusive and safe, and celebrates difference. We value and embrace our diverse perspectives and recognise the value diversity has in fuelling innovation and enabling brilliant experiences for our diverse community.

For Further Enquiries & How to Apply

All enquiries regarding this position will remain private and confidential and can be directed to Jordon Tomopoulos on 08 8203 7563.

Please submit a Resume, a copy of your academic transcript, and a Cover Letter expressing the skills, experience and qualities you can bring to this position addressed to Jordon Tomopoulos, Economic Research & Data Analyst.

Please review the position description prior to submitting an application by following the prompts to apply.

Applications close at 11.59pm, 15 October 2023.

Please be advised this is a full-time, two-year fixed term opportunity with a starting salary at the Level 3 Classification commencing at $77,210 11% superannuation.

We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, and people living with disability to apply.

We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive workplace. If you require assistance with our recruitment process, please call our People Services team on (08) 8203 7333.

Join an organisation with strong values, a community focus and a great culture!

About the Team

The Lending Quality Team is responsible for reviewing the accuracy of all inputs to Credit Ratings and Security Ratings prior to approval and reviewing and providing coaching and feedback on credit submissions processed via the Business and Agribusiness teams. The focus of the team is a proactive measure to:
• Support the Bank to ensure well managed portfolios are maintained.
• Ensure ongoing quality of the non-retail portfolio; and
• Generate a circle of continuous improvement through sharing of best practice.

About the role:

As the Lending Quality and Data Analyst you will be responsible for collating quantitative data of reviewed applications within the business customer portfolio and identifying trends for process and capability uplift opportunities.

Key responsibilities will include:
• Providing feedback to the Lending Quality Coaches, your leader, and other key stakeholders in analysis by identifying and making recommendations to the broader business on opportunities to address capability gaps and education needs.
• Developing insights and providing future strategies to key stakeholders based on findings and observations from the quantitative quality review data.
• Advocating for changes and ensuring change is adhered to, this may be procedural, system or people related.
• Completing remediation activities in line with the defined instructions provided to uplift the overall quality of data in the environment.

The data quality process is a governed activity enabling insights and trends across our business, detailing areas of focus to increase capability, unblock bottlenecks in teams and identify themes of focus for continuous improvement.

Does this sound like you?
• Demonstrated experience in statistical visualisation and interpretation of data.
• Strong strategic application of data and insights, with the ability to translate complex analytics into actionable insights.
• Proficiency with using Microsoft Office products specifically advanced in Excel & Word.
• Ability to develop and maintain relationships with Business Banking and Credit Risk team members, to provide an understanding of key risks identified within reviews and follow up that recommended remediation has occurred.
• Critical thinking analysis and ability to communicate outcomes.
• Ability to work as part of a remote team

About Bendigo Bank

With more than 160 years of history, we are proud of our position in the community with more satisfied customers than any other Australian bank. Every day, we work hard to bring our company purpose to life; feeding into the success of our customers and communities and not off it.

We're more than just a bank with banking products. We change the lives of customers and communities. Commercial actions with heart!

Our time is now. We are challenging the status quo and we're excited about our future!

Why us?

There's so much more to a career with Bendigo and Adelaide Bank than just banking.

Get real benefits, work life balance and flexibility. You bring your brilliant mind, and we’ll help you take your learning to the next level with on-the-job training and external development opportunities - we want you to shine. After all, YOU are the difference that makes us the better big bank.

We believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness, injury or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.

So, if you’re excited to be part of an organisation with strong values and a community focus apply now!

If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

What's in it for you?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.

As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.

What We're Looking For

Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.

Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.

Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.

Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.

Run human centred design sessions with end-users.

Communicating and influencing stakeholders.

Coaching non-data experts how to use data.

Skills And Attributes For Success

Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.

Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.

Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.

Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems.

Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.

Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.

Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you

Ideal Candidate
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent research skills.
• Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
• Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia.
• Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
• Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
• Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
• Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
• Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
• Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
• All work must be of an independent nature.

Technical requirements to perform the work

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:
- A logon account unique to you
- Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
- Only one member per household may apply
NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

Benefits

· Work up to 20 hours per week.
· Earn a competitive rate of pay.
· Develop your research skills.
· Avoid the long commute.
· Work from the comfort of your home office.
· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours

Apply Online Today

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

data.job_description:
Every child and young person deserves a great education.

We have a strategy that aims to unlock every child’s potential now and into the future, one that in partnership with learners, students, parents and the wider South Australian community will build a world-leading public education system. One that is equitable and prioritises learning and wellbeing.

Together we will make our education system the best it can be.

When our children and young people thrive, so do our communities and our state.

About The Role

The Data and Automation Analyst is responsible to the Assistant Director, ICT Projects for driving the strategy, planning, review and execution of comprehensive data and automation processes for ICT during migration from the legacy platforms to the cloud-based Education Management System (EMS) and ongoing. This will involve working closely with Finance, System Performance, Information Communications and Technology, EMS Project Team and schools and preschools to determine and perform activities required as part of the data (migration and integration) and automation process.

Why work with us

By Joining Our Team, You Will
• Be part of a supportive and collaborative team environment.
• Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge.
• Enjoy work-life balance with flexible working arrangements.
• Make a real difference in the lives of children.

Together, we can work towards building a stronger future for all students in South Australia.

Requirements

Experience with Data Analysis, migration, integration or automation (using RPA), moder and cloud based technologies. (Essential)

Special Conditions

The successful applicant is required to gain a Department for Human Services (DHS) working with children check (WWCC) prior to being employed which is required to be renewed every five years before expiry. The incumbent will be required to undertake RRHAN –EC (Responding to Risks of Harm, Abuse and Neglect - Education Care) Facilitator Lead (Masterclass) extended course or the online (Fundamentals) course which will be required to be updated every three years.

For all other Special Conditions please refer to the attached Position Descriptions.

Application Instructions

Applicants are required to submit a CV and a written statement of no more than 1500 words addressing the key competencies in the position description. In addition, applicants are required to fill and submit the attached Application Cover Sheet and Employment Declaration forms.

People of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent and/or those who have a disability are strongly encouraged to apply.

Applications must be made through the I Work For SA website.

Remuneration

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

ASO7: $106,512- $115,137 per annum plus superannuation

Enquiries

Please direct your enquiries to Troy Mcmellon, Data and Automation Manager on Email: troy.mcmellon@sa.gov.au

Additional Note

This is a full-time (1.0 FTE) contract for two years.

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best

Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career

Banking, finance and wellbeing program discounts

We are seeking a talented Reporting & Insights Analyst with experience in Tableau and a passion for data to join our Client, Industries & Markets enablement team. This role can be based in any major city, and we offer excellent flexible working arrangements.

What will your typical day look like?
As a Reporting and Insights Consultant, you will enhance existing, and develop new business performance reporting, in Tableau, for stakeholders across Deloitte, including senior executive leaders. Working with the wider team, you will independently translate business requirements into quantitative metrics, with our boarder team looking to you, as an expert on all things Tableau and data. You will answer the ‘Why’ and ‘So What’ for our internal stakeholders, investigating trends and outliers within large datasets.

About us
At Deloitte, delivering impactful work and experiences to our clients is central to everything we do. We do this by being client issues-led, seamlessly integrating our capabilities to show up as one Deloitte, with relevance, impact and differentiation.

This role is internal facing and is part of the Client, Industries & Markets (CI&M) enablement team, supporting the CI&M Executive who oversee our go-to-market strategy and client interface for the Firm.

Enough about us, lets talk about you

You are someone with experience in gathering and analysing data sets to translate problems into actionable insights and recommendations.

With your commercial acumen, you are familiar with financial terminology and the reporting requirements of a business. Strong analytical capabilities and structured problem-solving skills are your strength, you can independently curate dashboard content and tell compelling data stories.

Specifically, you should have:

Demonstrated experience translating business problems into actionable dashboard views (from initial scoping to delivery)

Demonstrated experience developing dashboards in Tableau (12 Months + experience), and in building data models in excel.

12 months + experience working with varying levels of stakeholders and working with a business to develop/ mature reporting to meet asks.

Excellent communication skills with an ability to communicate at all levels.

Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite

We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English
You must be living in Australia the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Australia
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

face2face reference: 591408

Location: Nationwide - Remote

Hours: Full-time

Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)

Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline

Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

data.job_title: Data Analytics Senior Consultant / Manager - People Advisory Services
data.job_description:
Could the skills you build here unlock doors anywhere?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Due to continued success and growth, an exciting opportunity exists for a Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager to join our highly regarded People Advisory Services team.

Our team works as a well-integrated national team, where you’ll have the opportunity to work with Australian-based and multinational clients across the country, therefore offering you the ability to work with large corporates, and a diverse range of industries. In this role, you will have access to training, coaching and support that’s available to help grow your career even further!

This role is open to various locations - Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, and Perth.

What’s in it for you?

As our Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager - your responsibilities will include:
• Modelling of various Industrial Instrument (including Enterprise Bargaining Agreements, Industry Awards etc.) for wage compliance projects;
• Modelling of superannuation and Pay-As-You-Go Withholding data modelling projects (including the preparation of superannuation guarantee charge statements and voluntary disclosure letters);
• Liaise directly with clients and other regulatory authorities (e.g. Australian Taxation Office, Fair Work Australia etc.) in the delivery of data projects;
• Work with different parts of the business in driving growth in the global mobility data analytics practice;
• Preparing & presenting training seminars to both clients and team members.

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Degree in Data Analytics/Commerce, or similar;
• Between 1-5 years’ experience in a data analytics discipline (focused towards wage compliance and employment taxes remediation);
• Experience with Alteryx at the intermediate or advanced level;
• Experience with data visualisation software such as Power BI and Tableau;
• Experience with SQL, Python, and other database/coding languages [preferred];
• Ability to lead and mentor junior members of our team;
• Commitment to excellence in client service, with the ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.

What We Can Offer You

• Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness

data.job_title: Junior Data Analyst (Remote Internship – Data Analysis)
data.job_description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you an aspiring data analyst seeking an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience while working with a prestigious Management Consulting firm? TalentKompass Deutschland, a leading Human Resources company based in Germany, is searching for a highly motivated Data Analysis Intern to join our esteemed client. This remote position offers a unique chance for someone who is passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

As a Data Analysis Intern, you will work closely with the analytics and consulting teams, where you will be responsible for a range of tasks, including data collection, data cleaning, and statistical analysis. You will have the extraordinary opportunity to learn from experienced professionals who will provide mentorship and guidance throughout the internship. With this internship, you will gain valuable experience in data analysis, data visualization, and teamwork – all essential skills for a successful career in this field.

Responsibilities:
• Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support consulting projects
• Assist in the development of data models and statistical analysis to identify trends and insights
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data
• Create data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or Power BI
• Present findings and insights to the consulting team and contribute to project reports
• Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for data-driven solutions
• Support the team with general administrative tasks as needed

Requirements:
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
• Familiarity with data analysis principles and practices
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
• Knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques is a plus
• Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus

At TalentKompass Deutschland, we are committed to helping our interns develop their skills and reach their full potential. Our client is a reputable Management Consulting firm that will provide invaluable experience in a competitive industry. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to grow your career in data analysis – apply now!

Provide key insights for South Australia's commercial real estate markets
Join an experienced Research team & grow your career
Collaborative team culture with a diverse mix of work
Adelaide | Land of the Kaurna people

CBRE Adelaide is seeking a research analyst to join their team. In collaboration with the wider research team you will partner with CBRE business lines and clients by providing an innovative range of research and analysis, serving as a trusted advisor across commercial and residential property markets in Australia and New Zealand.

Here's what you'll achieve:
• Collect, review, evaluate, & analyse data, using internal databases, external data and macro-economic, financial and demographic information, ensuring insight and meaning is captured
• Assisting in the development and implementation of data management processes and data-based outputs/data visualisation products
• Prepare regular research reports and presentations, and other market analysis, including one-off consultancy assignments and more tailored research pieces to drive thought leadership
• You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with Head of Research, Directors, Sector Leads and business stakeholders to generate ideas and produce innovative research materials that best meet business & client needs.

About you:
• Degree qualified with 1-2 years' working experience in an economic, investment, policy or property research role
• Interest in gaining exposure and building a comprehensive knowledge of commercial property markets
• Ability to source data, analyse trends, create insights, and present results verbally, graphically and in writing
• Strong numerical skills and knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint, with a keen interest in learning and using data analytics tools (Tableau, PowerBI) and sales database systems (especially Salesforce)
• Excellent communication skills and enjoy a high degree of integration and collaboration with stakeholders within our business.

What's in it for you?

People are the foundation upon which our success is built. Our company is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. Our people are free to expand their skills and knowledge to drive their careers and reach their full potential.

We value flexibility and our people work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their well-being, learning and performance. Our people benefit from a range of educational, financial, health and well-being benefits and programs, corporate partnerships and discounts, CBRE Cares Foundation, competitive leave offerings and paid volunteer days.

Can we inspire you to join us?

At CBRE, our unwavering commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion begins with you. We are strengthening our inclusive culture, so everyone feels safe, valued, & heard. Because when you belong, we all succeed. We welcome and encourage First Nations Peoples to apply.

If you are successful in progressing, you may be asked to complete a short video interview as part of the recruitment process.

We look forward to hearing from you

data.job_description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Australia

"

edX, part of 2U Inc., works with respected universities and organizations to deliver innovative, skills-based training to a community of over 45 million learners around the world to support them at every stage of their lives and careers. edX delivers boot camps through an immersive learning experience with expert services and valuable resources. As of 2021, graduates have been hired by 6,700+ companies, including more than 62% of the Fortune 100.

The Job:

2U is seeking a Data Science professional who has a passion for making a difference. Our students have a diverse background, from working professionals to recent college graduates who seek to transition into careers in Big Data. Instructors will have a direct hand in changing the lives of our students.

This is a fully remote, part-time position.

Why teach with us?

Instructors, with the help of Teaching Assistants; lead classroom discussions, emphasize the meta-skills and core concepts, support students in their projects and challenges, and provide feedback to students. You don't have to have a ton of experience with teaching! You just have to be a lifelong learner, proven teacher or mentor, or love to help people change their lives to succeed.

What You Will Do:
• Lead online lectures following a detailed lesson plan that includes an active discussion environment and project-based learning
• Bring the learning experience to life by building community and enhancing relevance by drawing on your own industry experience
• Translate complex subject matter in a clear and concise manner for a diverse range of learners or skill levels
• Provide support and encouragement to students as they go through a life-changing experience
• Create an engaging, positive, and inclusive learning environment for our students
• Increase participant engagement using different facilitation tactics
• Guide large and small groups of learners in an empathetic manner
• Amplify student satisfaction by creating a positive classroom culture
• Communicating timely with students and leveraging effective interventions by sharing resources

Skills & Requirements:
• Bachelor's Degree Preferred
• Minimum of 5 years of work experience in Data Science
• Completion of background check with satisfactory results, determined at edX’s discretion, is required
• Must have a laptop, camera, at least one additional monitor, microphone / headset, and reliable internet access.
• A positive attitude
• Ability to deliver lesson plans provided by 2U
• Share your own professional experiences and industry insight with the students
• Be able to infuse empathy, support, encouragement, and fun into the student experience

Proficiency in the following is required:
• Python Programming - Python, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib
• Databases - MySQL and MongoDB
• Business Intelligence Software - Tableau
• Advanced Topics - Big Data Analytics with Hadoop, and Machine Learning

Preferred but not required:
• Front End Web Visualization - HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript Charting, and D3.js

Logistics:
• 24-week program (this is a part-time commitment)
• Class Schedule: M/T/TH
• Class Times: 6:00 - 10:15pm (includes office hours and break)
• Classes are taught live online

Perks:
• Maintain your current career while teaching
• Hone your skills by teaching and mentoring others
• Expand your network by joining the thousands of industry professionals who make up our instructional staff
• Experience the gratitude and fulfillment that comes along with teaching and giving back to the tech community

Hourly salary only: In Australia, the anticipated hourly salary for this role is $43.92/hr - $45.06/hr. Note: The final compensation for this position may consider factors including the geographic location where the work is performed (candidate’s assigned office) and prior work experience of the candidate.
• 2U Diversity and Inclusion Statement*

At 2U, we are committed to building and sustaining a culture of belonging, respect, and inclusion. We are proud of the steps we’ve taken to bring together an employee base that embodies diverse walks of life, ideas, genders, ages, races, cultures, sexual orientations, abilities and other unique qualities. We strive to offer a workplace where every employee feels empowered by what makes us different, as well as by how we are alike.

About Us

It’s an exciting time for Discovery Parks. Since our inception in 2004 we have experienced extensive growth. We currently own and operate over 65 Holiday and workforce Parks throughout Australia and employ over 1100 people. Discovery Parks has recently acquired Australia’s largest network of parks – Top Parks.

At the heart of Discovery Parks are happy people: happy customers and happy staff. We are building a passionate, adaptable, high performance team that works together to help our customers discover what matters.

The Role

Discovery Holiday Parks is embracing the new normal and is undertaking an historic transformation to build the Park and Digital Experience of the future. Accordingly, significant investment is being made into technology and business processes to develop custom attribution and predictive models focusing on customer behavior across our entire accommodation network. This is an incredibly exciting opportunity to use the latest Microsoft tools and technologies to drive actionable insights to add value to the business.

The Data Scientist will apply the latest data science techniques within the context of our customers and business, to improve customer experience and drive returns.

This role will require you to;

· Lead the team that provides customer insights to the business across the customer journey

· Apply your broad skill-set across data and analytics to understand business problems, create insights and provide practical solutions

· Provide business solutions and optimisation through various statistical and quantitative methods

· Provide statistical models to support predictive analytics and deliver non-technical presentations to all levels of the business as well as technical documentation to the wider team

· Identify and develop the capability to track detailed competitor data and leverage existing internal data to inform smart customer lead decision making

· Conduct investigative analytics reports to inform the customer journey experience

· Liaise closely with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders, you will have a collaborative personal style and be commercial as well as customer focused

Your Experience

A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Finance, Economics along with working knowledge of data science, analytics, or data engineering is essential to the success of this role.

To be successful in this role you will have proficiency and experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques combined with a high level of proficiency with programming languages used in data science. You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills which will be utilised when working across cross function teams and external stakeholders.

You will possess a high level of energy, self-motivation, autonomy, initiative, flexibility and attention to detail to be successful in meeting the business demands at Discovery Parks. Your naturally upbeat and open style will fit our cultural values. You will have a highly organised mindset with the ability to assess the urgency of work allocated to you by various stakeholders.

Discovery is a dynamic company with an energetic ‘market disrupter’ reputation. If you are passionate, adventurous, and ready to hit the ground running, we want to hear from you.

Discover more to life - APPLY NOW!

Prior to an offer of employment being made, candidates must provide authority for a Federal Police Clearance to disclose any criminal offences or charges.

YOUR NEW EMPLOYER:
Our client is prominent South Australian organisation, based in the Adelaide CBD which operate in the Insurance industry. They have hundreds of staff across South Australia and a small team of 3 focused on business intelligence solutions, reporting and data visualisation for the organisation. They are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to provide professional, value added insights and data interpretation to their business stakeholders.

YOUR NEW ROLE:
You will have involvement with some of the following:
• Design, develop deliver analytical assets using BI tools.

• BI Solution Testing.

• Use Excel and Power Query Data Models.

ARE YOU A GOOD FIT?
To be successful, you will be an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst who will have relevant tertiary qualifications, Power BI certifications and an SQL programming certification. You will be task oriented, have good time management skills and be willing to learn. You will be service oriented and have good communication skills.
You will have the ESSENTIAL skills:
• Power BI Desktop dashboard and dataset development experience (12 months minimum)
• Experience with Power BI Dataflows
• SQL development experience (12 months minimum)
• Experience working within Australia

If you qualify for these essential criteria we strongly encourage you to apply. If you also possess any of the following that will be greatly received.

Ideally you may also possess some of the DESIRABLE skills:
• Health Insurance Industry experience
• Experience with Kimball Star Scheme data modelling methodology
• Experience with Power Query and Excel to deliver power pivot reporting solutions
• Experience with Crystal Reports & Crystal Server
• Experience developing in Excel and VBA to produce reporting solutions

Please write a quick cover letter addressing briefly the Essential and Desirable skills and experience and if you have experience and if so how much in order to be considered for the role.

WHY APPLY?
They are conveniently located in the Adelaide CBD. They have a well established and successful local business and they can train up staff members to develop within the organisation.

For more information email Erin or Manisha at

As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for identifying, defining and driving Fivecast products and features through a complete lifecycle

About The Role

As a Technical Business Analyst you will work within the Product Management Team in identifying, defining and driving Fivecast products and features through a complete lifecycle from inception to support. You will work with all areas of the Fivecast business, including Product Development, Engineering, Intelligence, Marketing and Sales to help execute the Product Roadmap.

You will develop a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and understanding of the customer’s problems and will work to define solutions to address them. They will also assist the Co-founder/VP Product Development with shaping the Product Roadmap and work on defining a go to market strategy for identified products and features.

For this role we are looking for someone who has worked on consumer facing web applications/products, can create such applications from scratch and also understand the competitive landscape, the market we are operating in and anticipate the market needs before they arise.

Requirements
• Australian citizenship required- due to eligibility for NV1 defence clearance requirement for the role
• Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or other related technical STEM fields
• 5+ years experience in Product Management / Technical Business Analysis / Systems Engineering
• Experience working on consumer facing, complicated Java web-apps or products
• Ability to work with stakeholders to elicit requirements, including clients and other engineering team members
• Ability to develop product specifications and meet deadlines
• Strong organisation skills, detail orientated, and a collaborative team player with strong communication skills
Qualities that make strong candidates:
• Experience in technology sector working with defence and government clients
• Understanding of analytic challenges in Defence and national security
About Fivecast

Fivecast is a world-leading provider of cutting-edge digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.

As a growing start-up with over 100 people globally, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their career in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment. We are headquartered in Adelaide, Australia with teams in Canberra, Virginia USA, and London UK.

Our Work Environment and Culture

Our Adelaide based headquarters is a purpose-built tech hub centrally based in vibrant Hutt Street. We moved into this brand-new space in early 2023 to allow for continued collaboration, innovation & growth.

Our space has been specifically engineered for brainstorming, idea generation, random encounters across teams and to suit our casual, relaxed culture. This has been achieved through amazing features, including an arcade room, pool table, fully equipped kitchens with fruit and snacks, barista quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities (showers, lockers, bike storage, etc), as well as comfortable breakout spaces.

Fivecast has a connected work culture with team members taking advantage of our social clubs, local cafes, bars, pubs and sporting facilities for team activities. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.

Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience and believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.

data.job_description:
• ASX Listed Energy Company - Adelaide Head Office
• Unique Adelaide based accounting opportunity.
• Competitive package and benefits

Beach Energy is an Adelaide based ASX-listed energy company pursuing an exciting growth strategy. We are seeking a tertiary qualified analyst with an interest in energy markets to join the Finance team responsible for Beach's petroleum sales from existing production assets.

About the Role

Reporting to the Finance Manager (VIC/NZ), the Business Analyst will be responsible for Financial and Joint Venture accounting within the Beach Capital Portfolio, comprising Stay in Business expenditure within the Operations function and Capital expenditure within the Exploration & Subsurface (E&S), and Development functions. This will include the preparation and analysis of accounting statements, reports, and reconciliations for operated and non-operated Joint Ventures.

The role partners with the Senior Business Analysts within the Finance team, and the Project Services team to ensure alignment between project cost control and finance requirements. Additionally, this role encompasses development and stewardship of Capital financial governance, compliance policies and processes, including Asset Recognition and Capitalisation, Prepayments and Project Inventory.

Key responsibilities will include:
• Delivering timely and accurate monthly reporting of operated joint ventures, including review of contribution and other general ledger account reconciliations
• Preparing account reconciliations supporting the balance sheet statements, including responding to audit requests.
• Preparing and distributing expenditure statements for Joint Ventures and manage queries from JV partners.
• Cash calling of external Joint Venture partners, in accordance with JOA requirements, including monitoring financial position of partners as appropriate and following up to ensure funds are received.
• Coordinating Joint Venture audits requested by the non-operator Joint Venture partners.
• Month end ledger close including the preparation and posting of accounting entries.
• Maintaining fixed asset registers including governance of useful lives, depreciation, asset disposals and additions in SAP

About You

The person we are seeking will be an enthusiastic self-starter looking for variety within a role and development through exposure to experienced industry peers. An adept attention to detail, and an ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

You will also need:
• Tertiary qualifications in accounting and CA/CPA qualified.
• Experience covering joint venture and management accounting.
• An ability to build relationships with a variety of stakeholders.
• Capability operating under tight timeframes and pressure.
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills including clear and concise writing skills.
• Proven SAP experience.

About Us

Beach Energy is an ASX listed oil and gas exploration and production company. Founded in 1961, our head office is in Adelaide, and we operate in several locations in Australia and in New Zealand.

Beach's purpose is to 'sustainably deliver energy for communities' and we are committed to producing the energy needed for a sustainable transition – one that supports the needs of societies today, and into the future. See our actions and plans in our Sustainability Report.

How to Apply

Beach is committed to improving gender diversity and Indigenous participation; we encourage all applications.

Please submit your application, cover letter and updated CV by 20 October 2023.

For this opportunity you must be eligible to work in Australia.

Analyst
Department : System Design
Division : Forecasting

Reference number : 10889

A true forecasting role in the fast-moving energy industry - incredible career opportunitgy with PV & battery focus. This is your opportunity to bring your passion and expertise and contribute to Australia's energy future. Design, run and communicate the model's that everyone's talking about (strong modelling skills in R, Python & SQL a must). Attractive salary and performance incentives. Open to Bris/Syd/Melb/Adel/Perth with hybrid working arrangements.

Who is AEMO?

We are the Australian Energy Market Operator. AEMO's role is to design and operate a sustainable energy system that provides safe, reliable, and affordable electricity and gas today, and to enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians. All Australian governments are now committed to a net-zero economy for Australia by 2050, the first step of which is a net-zero energy system.

We are collaborating with industry and other stakeholders to engineer electricity grids that can handle 100 per cent instantaneous renewable generation by 2025, and changes to the gas system and markets to support biomethane and hydrogen. AEMO also plays a significant role in the east coast gas market, which has recently expanded to assessing if there is enough natural gas for customers, including electricity generators. The transition to a renewable energy system is occurring at a world-leading pace. It is an exciting, momentous time to be part of this mission.

About the role

AEMO's forecasting division is responsible for providing long and medium-term forecasts of Australia's energy supply and demand. The team is responsible for delivering critical data that underpins many of our major reports and reliability processes.

At a time when Australia is witnessing a once in a century transformation of the Energy Industry this is an incredible opportunity to be part of a bespoke, supportive, and high performing team. This role is available across multiple office locations, including Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide & Perth – in addition to offering flexible work from home arrangements.

What you will be doing

Reporting into the Manager, Sector Coupling and working within a team of four, your focus is on how distributed PV and storage develop over timeframes of up to 30 years. You'll be part of robust discussions on consumer needs, market evolution, and technological development.

We're seeking a strategically minded analyst with a strong interest in PV and storage. Your daily role involves diving into PV and battery technology and crafting and refining forecasting models. Solid programming skills, including R and SQL are essential. Attention to detail and collaboration skills are crucial. You'll work within a friendly, supportive team that collaborate to strategise and test internal and external viewpoints. You will also:
• Be aware of and contribute to team understanding of industry trends.
• Develop, maintain, and document forecasting models for components of the electricity and gas markets. This involves analytical, programming, modelling and data management skills, working with others within and beyond the team.
• Interpret, validate, and gain insights from models, simulations, and ad-hoc datasets.
• Communicate your results via writing technical reports using clear and concise language that is understandable to a diverse audience.
• Have the ability to quickly and accurately complete analytical work within tight timeframes.
• Mentor and support graduates and students in the performance of their tasks.

What you will bring to the role
• Tertiary qualification in relevant disciplines (engineering, physics, mathematics, econometrics).
• At least 3 years' experience in analysis and modelling of energy markets or a related field.
• Experience working with Power BI and Excel, alongside R, Python, and SQL.
• Experience within Australia's energy systems, particularly Australia's electricity markets, is desirable or a willingness to learn and an interest in energy systems.
• Keen interest in data, energy markets, and the art and science of forecasting is well regarded.

Some of our employment benefits
• Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options
• Professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and formal learning
• A full health and wellbeing program, private health discounts and other concessions
• Free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility)
• Up to 4 days volunteering leave per year
• A comprehensive and professional Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

We are AEMO

At AEMO, our core values aren't just 'words on a wall' – we are a purpose-based organisation at the centre of our energy future, and we stand for integrity, inclusiveness, empowerment, and excellence.

As we continue to innovate and work on some world-first, ground-breaking projects, we need to attract the brightest people and provide opportunities to contribute, stretch and grow.

We actively encourage you to bring your whole self to work, so that together we can do better, be better, and love our work. For this reason, inviting difference and leading inclusively is a core part of our culture. We challenge ourselves to take bold actions to improve the experience for all our people, with a current focus on gender, flexibility, (dis)ability and our First Nation peoples.

If you would like to know more about working at AEMO, please check out our careers page for more information, or apply now. #joinaemo

For more information on the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) please refer to or visit one of our social media channels below.

We provide relocation assistance and support, and we'll also connect you with other friendly FDM Consultants who are based in your new location.*

Are you a recent graduate or End-of-Year Finisher looking to launch your career in tech?

Join our program for the chance to work with Australia’s leading companies including the top 4 banks, consultancies, insurance companies, retailers, and charities. Through our long relationships with FTSE100 client partners, you can add impressive names to your CV!

A career where you are encouraged to meet your potential

Junior Technical Analyst roles often involve high-profile projects in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and gaining first-hand exposure to business operations. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.

About This Role

If you are eager to take on a challenge and use your logical problem-solving skills to make an impact in the world of technology, then this is the role for you! Our program is designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to start and grow a successful career.

As a Technical Analyst, you will have the opportunity to apply your skills to innovative projects and make a real impact in a variety of sectors. You will be responsible for investigating and developing solutions for applications. It could be robotic process automation, quality assurance and IT infrastructure delivery for global businesses.

What will my time at FDM be like

Your journey will begin with training out of FDM’s award-winning academy. While interviews and assessments are done remotely, you now have the option to undertake training online or at our centrally located, 21st floor Sydney office in Barangaroo.

The 10-week industry specific training covers high-demand skills such as SQL, Unix; Excel/VBA, BA, Python, ITIL, Cloud and OS-Admin with the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout.

After successfully completing your training, you’ll step into an integral position with one or more of our industry-leading, multinational clients in Australia.

What we offer you:
• A full-time employment contract with job security
• Opportunities to work across Australia with relocation support where appropriate
• Training is provided by industry experts, covering both technical and professional skills to ensure you are job-ready
• Ongoing career support throughout your entire FDM journey, including professional development, mentoring, and social networking events with a community of peers
• A chance to launch a career in one of the most in-demand tech fields

We ask you have the following:
• Educated to a university degree level (bachelor or higher), no STEM degree required
• Demonstrable interest and desire to work in technology
• Ability to commit to completing our full 2.5-year graduate program
• Ability to relocate to Sydney or Melbourne to support our clients. (Relocation package will be provided)
• Eligible to work in Australia (Australian citizen or permanent resident)

There has never been a better time to start a career in tech – Apply Now!

About FDM

Our people are our passion. That's why we make your training and career growth our priority. We are a global professional services provider, focusing on IT. We are also one of the Australia's leading graduate employers, recruiting the brightest talent to become the innovators of tomorrow. With centres across Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific, and over 5,000 consultants placed on client site globally, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.

Adelaide PHN is seeking an experienced professional with skills in data analytics, and experience in reporting to join our team as Performance and Reporting Coordinator. This role is pivotal to understanding and sharing the impact of our work with funders and stakeholders, including the community we serve.

About Us

Adelaide Primary Health Network (Adelaide PHN) is an independent, not for profit, primary health care organisation based in Adelaide. We aim to improve the health and wellbeing of the Adelaide community by coordinating and integrating health and community services and by working in partnership to identify local needs and create strategies in response to keeping people well and out of hospital; improving their experience AND their health outcomes – to deliver on our vision of ‘shaping the health system to deliver better outcomes for vulnerable people, and a healthier Adelaide’.

The Role

Reporting to the Planning and Performance Manager, this role will lead the Adelaide PHN 12 month performance report and annual report, and work alongside the organisation and engage key stakeholders to develop, track, analyse and report on population health, service and organisational performance data.

The successful incumbent will provide and maintain accurate reports and reference materials for both internal and external audiences, covering key activities including Adelaide PHN’s process, regulatory and stakeholder reporting and interactions with the Commonwealth Department of Health, as well as identify as well as identify opportunities to streamline and improve internal and external reporting.

ABOUT YOU

Using your knowledge gained from a public health, population health, social science, health promotion, planning, evaluation, public/health sector management or similar relevant field, along with at least 5 years experience in a similar data analysis and performance reporting role, the successful incumbent will have demonstrated experienced in advanced computer skills, experience with data systems and reporting tools.

You will have the technical skills to interpret and provide high level analysis, contemporary and robust knowledge of data governance, a commitment to continuous improvement and be a skilled communicator to engage the organisation on key deliverables. An understanding of organisation wide key performance indicators and specifically in the health industry is vital.

In addition to this, to be successful in this role you’ll need:
• To be committed to the development, maintenance and improvement of data collection systems and management
• Be highly organised and able to communicate across the organisation to achieve high quality reporting
• Have the technical skills to interpret data requirements and calculate population health and service data accurately and consistently
• Be flexible and able to manage change and competing demands
• Work collaboratively in a diverse cross- functional work environment
• Be able to convey complex information, simply

Why you should come work with us

Adelaide PHN offers a great range of benefits to our employees, including:
• Competitive remuneration and work-life balance.
• Access to generous not for profit Salary Sacrifice taxation benefits including up to $15,900 for living expenses and $2,650 for meal and entertainment.
• Work from home opportunities.
• Additional paid leave between Christmas and New Year, in addition to annual leave entitlements.
• Generous allowance toward professional development.
• Family friendly and flexible working arrangements.
• Collaboration with passionate like-minded professionals.
• Free Employment Assistance Program.

How to Apply

To apply please click on Apply Now - include in your application a maximum 2 page covering letter outlining your suitability for the role against the skills and experience required, together with your resume.

Applications will ONLY be considered when received through our careers portal.

To apply, you must have the legal right to work in Australia.

Shortlisting for this position may commence earlier than the closing date.

For further information about this role, please contact Donna Shotton, Planning and Performance Manager on 08 8219 5900 or dshotton@adelaidephn.com.au using the subject line: Performance and Reporting Coordinator enquiry via EthicalJobs.

OUR STORY

Blackwoods is Australia’s leading supplier of industrial and safety supplies. For over 140 years, we have supported businesses big and small with our range of over 300,000 products from the world’s best brands. From the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the railway and your local mechanic, we supply what our customers need when they need it, along with unparalleled expertise and service from our passionate team.

With a national footprint of over 50 branches and 6 Distribution Centres, our people are at the heart of everything we do. Being a part of the Wesfarmers group, also means that we have endless opportunities to make a difference, so join us, and let’s help more people build a better Australia.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY

Due to exciting growth in the business, we are looking for an enthusiastic National Sales Analyst to join our sales team based in any capital city (such as Macquarie Park NSW, Carole Park QLD, Regency Park SA and Scoresby VIC) to provide an exceptional level of service that supports our growing customer base.

This role is responsible for ensuring customer data alignment and/or key sales data including incentives and territory mapping is correct. This role will ensure data for all customer territory applications is aligned with Blackwoods systems, reducing errors, and facilitating clean order fulfilment.

Your key responsibilities include, but not limited to:
• Ensure data alignment is maintained to support key sales hierarchy activity and reporting
• Build excel models to support commercial decision making
• Create and maintain robust suites of reporting that illustrate performance across multiple stakeholder groups
• Drive functional Teams (primarily, Sales) understanding in how to utilise data and make commercial decisions
• Engage stakeholders at all levels to ensure process around mapping and alignment can be actioned quickly

To be successful, you will have:
• Ability to plan and schedule priorities, manage strict deadlines, work autonomously and adapt to changing situations
• Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills
• Strong written and verbal communication
• Understanding and applying new technologies
• Collaborative approach with the ability to build effective partnerships within own team and across the organisation

CULTURE & BENEFITS

A career with Blackwoods will offer you rewarding experiences and opportunities for growth and development. We have a diverse, inclusive, and safe workplace where our team members care about each other and enjoy building meaningful connections.

To ensure our employees feel valued, supported, and celebrated, we provide a range of employee benefits including:
• Competitive salaries and incentives
• Flexible work arrangements
• A range of diversity and well-being initiatives
• Ability to purchase up to 4 weeks additional annual leave
• Team events, celebrations and development opportunities
• Team member discounts on Wesfarmers products
• Discounted offers from over 300 corporate partners
• Generous Wesfarmers annual share plans
• Attractive parental leave policy and more

NEXT STEPS

If you meet most of the criteria listed above and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please send your application today. We will be contacting suitable candidates as we receive them.

As part of our recruitment process and commitment to safety, you may be required to undertake background checks (which may include a police check, a pre-employment medical assessment; and/or drug & alcohol testing) as part of your application process.

Blackwoods also promotes diversity and inclusion across our workplaces and encourages applications from all backgrounds, including people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, the LGBTI+ community and people with disabilities.

Please note: All applications will be reviewed after 3rd October 2023.

The difference you will make at Insignia Financial

In the role of the Salesforce Technical Business Analyst, you will take an active and forward-looking approach to enhance project delivery. This includes providing leadership to analysts and collaborating closely with the Delivery Manager to ensure the successful execution of team activities and deliverables.

You Will Make a Difference By
• Conducting in-depth technical analysis, addressing complex business requirements and processes
• Serving as a pivotal link between stakeholders and the delivery team, taking charge of complex issues across various applications that involve multiple parties
• Evaluating existing processes and systems, offering recommendations for process enhancements
• Providing subject matter expertise and conduct business analysis for intricate projects
• Developing position statements on complex subject matter inquiries
• Assisting in Incident Management during Business as Usual (BAU) operations, identifying the root causes and facilitating defect remediation within stipulated SLAs
• Providing comprehensive support throughout the end-to-end delivery process, including technical requirements, testing, and change management for planned releases and maintenance windows as needed

A Little Bit About You
• Possess business and/or technology expertise, acquired within the Financial Services sector or other related industries
• Extensive experience, with a significant portion dedicated to working with Salesforce
• Hold tertiary qualifications or possess equivalent industry experience
• Demonstrate prior experience in various business practices, with a particular focus on Financial Services, especially in superannuation and fund management
• Expert in systems design, integration, and function/data analysis within specific business functions
• Exhibit effective communication and interpersonal skills, crucial for effective stakeholder engagement, including the ability to conduct showcases
• Adopt a proactive approach to problem-solving, critical thinking, and the identification of opportunities for improvement

Life at Insignia Financial

From people just starting out, to those about to retire – every day we help more Australians secure their future. Helping our clients reach their financial goals sooner is our specialty. Few others can match the range of wealth management products and services we offer.

Insignia Financial is an ASX Top 200 company, and one of one of Australia’s leading wealth managers. We use our scale and expertise to invest in a future that’s better for everyone. We believe success comes from caring about people, consistent performance, and outstanding service. And we recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference: this applies to employees and clients alike.

Diversity and ensuring our people feel they belong is important to us, we take pride in putting our people, as well as our clients, first and value and celebrate diversity within all our teams.

We have a Women in Technology community which exists to bring together female and non-binary people within the tech world at Insignia Financial. This supportive forum is eager to progress and make change in the technology space – does this sound like you?

With many of us now working from home more than the office, we understand the importance of flexibility. As we work in a hybrid environment, you’ll ‘work where it works’ for you, your team, and our clients. We also offer varied and flexible leave offerings, including 12 weeks paid parental leave and an extra day of leave each year.

We encourage our people to have an impact on the broader community we serve through volunteering leave.

At Insignia Financial, it’s important to us that our people feel secure about their own money. We have an extensive financial wellbeing offering available to our people, including access to financial advice, mortgage, and insurance brokers, Will and estate planning services and more.

Join us and contribute to achieving our ambition of creating financial wellbeing for all Australians through living our Principles: be human, deliver what matters, stronger together, keep it simple and do what’s right, not what’s easy.

To apply

Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now".

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.

Job Description

Job Title: Commercial Analyst - Drakes Supermarkets

Location: Adelaide, SA

Almost 50 years since Roger Drake purchased his first supermarket in 1974, Drakes Supermarkets has now become the largest independent grocery retailer in Australia.

Drakes Supermarkets is a proudly Australian-owned and independent retail chain, committed to providing exceptional service and quality products to our valued customers. With a strong emphasis on community involvement and supporting local suppliers, they have grown to become a trusted name in the retail industry.

The Opportunity

As a Commercial Analyst at Drakes Supermarkets, you will be an integral part of business communicating key data insights around shrinkage, consumer behaviours, sales and profit of the fresh food departments to help the organsiation make data driven decisions that drive the business forward.

Key Responsibilities
• Reporting Development, Modelling, Maintenance, and Enhancement:
• Develop and maintain a comprehensive monthly reporting suite for Fresh Supervisors and Store Managers.
• Understand the specific information needs of the fresh food management team and tailor reports accordingly.
• Assist in the development of annual Fresh Food Department budgets for sales, wages, and gross profit.
• Actively participate in the month-end close process and review Fresh Food Departments' profitability.
• Implement procedures and reporting requirements to improve shrinkage within our fresh areas of operation.
• Create insightful dashboards to monitor the performance of key Fresh initiatives such as 'Bakery Model,' 'The Little Kitchen,' and 'Store Concepts.'
• Ensure transparent, visual and accurate Fresh P&L reporting.
• Commercial Analysis:
• Conduct quarterly analysis and benchmarking of Fresh Food Department
• Provide analysis and support for new Fresh Food opportunities, contributing to robust business cases.
• Collaborate with the Commercial Manager to coordinate and manage quarterly performance reviews with the Fresh Food Manager and Supervisors.
• Analyse monthly performance data for Fresh departments and entities, identifying trends and improvement areas.
• Work closely with Fresh Food Supervisors to identify budget shortfalls and develop action plans for improvement.
• Identify underperforming Fresh Food Departments and devise strategies to enhance their profit performance.
• Ensure optimal inventory levels in Fresh Food Departments, aligning with maximum days sales cover.
• Perform a key Fresh Food operating expenditure analysis, including areas such as wages and freight.
• Continuous Process Improvement:
• Collaborate with Fresh Food Supervisors to implement profit improvement initiatives and track their effectiveness.
• Utilise data to proactively highlight operational performance issues and work with the team to implement improvements.
• Identify opportunities for terms improvement with suppliers, contributing to cost efficiencies.
• Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the Finance Team, ensuring our financial reporting evolves to support Drakes' profitability.
• Initiate initiatives to promote a cohesive one-team culture within the commercial analytics team and the wider Fresh Finance team.

Experience And Skills
• * Proven experience in budget development and analysis.
• Exposure to Data Visual Applications is essential to the success of the role.
• Being able to translate and articulate the data to decision makers is imperative.
• Background in the commercial retail or fast-moving consumer goods industry.
• Demonstrated expertise in modeling and complex data analysis.
• Track record of identifying, planning, and successfully implementing improvements.

Drakes Supermarkets is an equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

For more details please contact Thilini Elkaduwa at EGM Partners for a confidential discussion.
